hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via Breakout Confirmation with Options Flow
hypothesis_content.statement: When NEUTRAL regime is accompanied by a clear breakout above a 20-day consolidation range (>3% break) with supporting options flow (25-delta call skew > 5% and call buying volume > 2x put buying volume), the regime will transition to BULL within 3 days with 80% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often precede directional moves. A clean breakout with options market confirmation (smart money positioning) suggests conviction rather than false breakout. Moderate positive funding shows healthy leverage build-up without immediate over-extension.
entry_conditions: Price breaks above 20-day consolidation range by >3%
25-delta call skew > 5% (calls more expensive than puts)
Call option buying volume > 2x put buying volume
Funding rates turn positive but remain below 0.02% (avoiding over-leverage)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price falls back into consolidation range or regime remains NEUTRAL after 5 days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such breakouts fail to sustain and price returns to consolidation range, with regime remaining NEUTRAL.
